title: CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) tools
description:
CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) poses a serious threat to a wide range of Java-based applications.
Our OSS tools help developers answer the following important questions:
1. Does my code include log4j2?
2. Where does my code use log4j2?
3. Am I configuring this correctly?

title: CVE-2022-22965 (SpringShell) tools
description: The SpringShell (CVE-2022-22965) vulnerability may affect some web applications using Spring Framework, but requires a number of conditions to be exploitable. One specific condition which may be rather rare (and therefore render most applications non-exploitable in practice) is the existence of Spring endpoints which bind request parameters to a non-primitive (Java Bean) type.

title: CVE-2022-29799 (Nimbuspwn) tools
description: Nimbuspwn (CVE-2022-29799 & CVE-2022-29800), a vulnerability in the networkd-dispatcher daemon discovered by the Microsoft 365 Defender Research Team.

title: CVE-2018-25032 tools
description: CVE-2018-25032 is a vulnerability in the ubiquitous zlib compression library, which can be triggered when the deflateInit2 API is called using non-default arguments.

title: CVE-2021-4034 (PwnKit) tools
description: PwnKit is a trivial-to-exploit local privilege escalation vulnerability that affects every major Linux distribution.

title: npm tools
description: A collection of tools to help audit your NPM dependencies for suspicious packages or continuously monitor dependencies for future security events.

title: CVE-2022-42889 (TextShell) tools
description:
The TextShell vulnerability (CVE-2022-42889) affects users of the popular Apache Commons Text package, that use String Interpolation APIs.
Exploiting the vulnerability is trivial in relevant cases and leads to remote code execution.
